All Classes

Class Description
Admin
Manages all of the users records, including the admins.
Architect
The architect manages every construction and therefore there is only one instance.
Construction
This class contains the blueprint of each construction.
ConstructionManager
Construction manager will hand out tasks to construction workers, which it got from the architect.
ConstructionWorker
Construction workers do the tasks slowly and in a multithreaded way.
Coordinate  
CustomButton  
Customer
Has ordered a construction at least once.
CustomLabel  
CustomLayeredPane  
CustomPasswordField  
CustomProgressBar  
CustomTextField  
FileErrorException
When any error has occurred while serialising or writing to a file, this error will be thrown.
FileManager
This class has all the methods, which works with serialising or changing user data, which needs to be stored permanently.
FileManager.Action
What should happen to the user, when serialising.
Guest
Plain new freshly registered user, who has not ordered a construction yet.
ICustom  
IPainter  
IPerson  
IScene
Make sure, that every scene has the getSceneID, setDefaultObjects, onActive methods for the scene manager.
ListUsers
This is an overview window, where the roles can be seen while listing users.
LoginScene
The default scene on app startup.
ManageUsers
The scene for listing users and changing or deleting their records.
MenuScene
The main menu, where all available actions can be accessed.
Name
Accessing methods and variables to store the users full name.
Object
Basic information, which every object drawn on the pane should have.
OrderConstruction
Guests and customers can order a new construction in this scene.
Person
The basic data schema for all users.
ProfileSettings
Users can set their login credentials and names here.
program  
RegisterScene
The scene for registering a new user to the system.
Row
In admin panel these rows will be displayed as a tweaked JPanel.
Row.Direction
How should the row be displayed - horizontally or vertically.
Scene
Scenes are parts of the GUI.
SceneManager
This is the GUI framework.
Settings
All static parts of the program is located here.
Settings.RANK  
ShowProfile
Display a nice profile page for each user.
Sprite
This class is the same as the object, but it has a texture in it, which will be renderen on the exact place, where we define it.
Task
Tasks are part of the construction.
TextFieldWithPlaceholder
JTextField with extra features, like automatic centering and having placeholder values.
User
Basic information schema for the user.
UserManager
This class handles all user actions and changes GUI elements or file systems.
ViewConstruction
The user who has an active construction under the way, can see its progress here.
